module.name: DBGrids
module.short: Data-Aware Grids to display and operate on information held in a database

element.name: EInvalidGridOperation
element.short: EInvalidGridOperation - exception class for invalid grid operatins

element.name: TCustomDbGrid
element.short: TCustomDBGrid - the Base class for TDBGrid, a data-aware component for displaying information from a database in the manner of a Stringrid

element.name: TColumn
element.short: TColumn - one of the physical columns of the display in a DataBase Grid (not necessarily the same as a Column in a SQL database)

descr.p: TColumn - one of the physical columns of the display in a DataBase Grid

Each column may display the information held in a Field of the DataSet to which the DBGrid is attached, but the order of appearance of the columns need not correspond to the order in which the Fields exist in the DataSet, nor need all Fields be represented by a Column.

element.name: TDataSetScrolledEvent
element.short: TDataSetScrolledEvent - generic method for handling scrolling events in a DataSet

element.name: TDBGridClickEvent
element.short: TDBGridClickEvent - generic event handling method for a click in the specified column of a DataBase Grid

element.name: TMovedEvent
element.short: TMovedEvent - generic event handler method for moving between FromIndex and ToIndex in a DataBase Grid

element.name: TDrawColumnCellEvent
element.short: TDrawColumnCellEvent - generic event handler method for drawing a cell in a specified column in a DataBase Grid

element.name: TGetDbEditMaskEvent
element.short: TGetDbEditMaskEvent - generic event handler method for obtaining an Edit Mask in a DataBase Grid

element.name: TDBGridOption
element.short: TDBGridOption - enumerated type, containing options available for a DataBase Grid

element.name: TDbGridExtraOption
element.short: TDbGridExtraOption - some extra options available for DataBase Grids

element.name: TDbGridExtraOptions
element.short: TDbGridExtraOptions - set of TDbGridExtraOption

element.name: TDbGridOptions
element.short: TDbGridOptions - set of TDbGridOption

element.name: TDbGridStatusItem
element.short: TDbGridStatusItem - enumerated type containing items available for defining DataBase Grid status

element.name: TDbGridStatus
element.short: TDbGridStatus set of TDbGridStatusItem

element.name: TDbGridSelEditorEvent
element.short: TDbGridSelEditorEvent - generic event handling method for selecting an Editor for a DataBase Grid

element.name: TPrepareDbGridCanvasEvent
element.short: TPrepareDbGridCanvasEvent - generic event handling method for preparing the Canvas for a DataBase Grid

element.name: TBookmarkList
element.short: TBookmarkList - a list of Bookmarks in a DataBase Grid

element.name: TBookmarkList.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TBookmarkList: calls inherited Create, attaches Grid and initialises list

element.name: TBookmarkList.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TBookmarkList: clears and frees the list then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TBookmarkList.Clear
element.short: Clear the list of Bookmarks

element.name: TBookmarkList.Delete
element.short: Delete the Bookmarks from the list one by one

element.name: TBookmarkList.Find
element.short: Find the nominated Bookmark string, returning its index; result (boolean) is True if successful

element.name: TBookmarkList.IndexOf
element.short: IndexOf - returns the index of the nominated Bookmark string

element.name: TBookmarkList.Refresh
element.short: Refresh - searches for any invalid Bookmarks, which it removes: returns True if the action was successful

element.name: TBookmarkList.Count
element.short: Count - the number of Bookmarks in the list

element.name: TBookmarkList.CurrentRowSelected
element.short: CurrentRowSelected - True if the current row is selected

element.name: TBookmarkList.Items
element.short: Items - the list of Bookmarks as an indexed array of strings

element.name: TColumnOrder
element.short: TColumnOrder - enumerated type defining alternative ordering methods for the columns

descr.p: TColumnOrder - enumerated type defining alternative ordering methods for the columns
Can be design order, or ordered by field index

element.name: TComponentDataLink
element.short: TComponentDataLink - forms a link between a component and a DataSet and contains event handlers to operate on the records

element.name: TComponentDataLink.RecordChanged
element.short: RecordChanged - calls the OnRecordChanged event handler if it has been assigned

element.name: TComponentDataLink.DataSetChanged
element.short: DataSetChanged - calls the OnDataSetChanged event handler if it has been assigned

element.name: TComponentDataLink.ActiveChanged
element.short: ActiveChanged - if there has been a change in the Active status, calls the appropriate event handler for the change

descr.p: ActiveChanged - if there has been a change in the Active status, calls the appropriate event handler for the change
May call one of the following:

element.name: TComponentDataLink.LayoutChanged
element.short: LayoutChanged - calls the OnLayoutChanged event handler if it is assigned

element.name: TComponentDataLink.DataSetScrolled
element.short: DataSetScrolled - calls the OnDataSetScrolled event handler if it is assigned

element.name: TComponentDataLink.EditingChanged
element.short: EditingChanged - calls OnEditingChanged if it is assigned

element.name: TComponentDataLink.UpdateData
element.short: UpdateData - calls OnUpdataData event handler if it is assigned

element.name: TComponentDataLink.Modified
element.short: Modified - True if the data have been modified

element.name: TComponentDataLink.OnRecordChanged
element.short: OnRecordChanged - event handler for a change in the current record

element.name: TComponentDataLink.OnDataSetChanged
element.short: OnDataSetChanged - event handler for a change in the attached Data Set

element.name: TComponentDataLink.OnNewDataSet
element.short: OnNewDataSet - event handler for formation of a link to a new data set

element.name: TComponentDataLink.OnDataSetOpen
element.short: OnDataSetOpen - event handler when the data set is open

element.name: TComponentDataLink.OnInvalidDataSet
element.short: OnInvalidDataSet - event handler when the data set is non-valid

element.name: TComponentDataLink.OnInvalidDataSource
element.short: OnInvalidDataSource - event handler when the data source is non-valid

element.name: TComponentDataLink.OnLayoutChanged
element.short: OnLayoutChanged - event handler when the layout of the data set has changed

element.name: TComponentDataLink.OnDataSetClose
element.short: OnDataSetClose - event handler when the data set is closed

element.name: TComponentDataLink.OnDataSetScrolled
element.short: OnDataSetScrolled - event handler when the data set is scrolled

element.name: TComponentDataLink.OnEditingChanged
element.short: OnEditingChanged - event handler for a change in the Editing property

element.name: TComponentDataLink.OnUpdateData
element.short: OnUpdateData - event handler for implementing any pending changes to data

element.name: TComponentDataLink.DataSetName
element.short: DataSetName - the (string) name of the attached data set

element.name: TComponentDataLink.Fields
element.short: Fields - an indexed array containing the fields of the dataset

element.name: TColumnTitle
element.short: TColumnTitle - class of TGridColumnTitle

element.name: TColumn
element.short: TColumn - one of the physical columns of the display in a DataBase Grid (not necessarily the same as a Column in a SQL database)

descr.p: TColumn - one of the physical columns of the display in a DataBase Grid

Each column may display the information held in a Field of the DataSet to which the DBGrid is attached, but the order of appearance of the columns need not correspond to the order in which the Fields exist in the DataSet, nor need all Fields be represented by a Column.

element.name: TColumn.GetField
element.short: Find which field's data is to be displayed in this column

element.name: TColumn.GetPickList
element.short: GetPickList - calls inherited GetPickList, then if there are additional items, adds them before returning

element.name: TColumn.GetDataSet
element.short: Find which DataSet is to be used

element.name: TColumn.GetDefaultReadOnly
element.short: GetDefaultReadOnly - if a grid or field have been assigned, gets the default readonly property from the link, otherwise calls inherited GetDefaultReadOnly

element.name: TColumn.GetDefaultWidth
element.short: GetDefaultWidth - looks to see if a grid with canvas has been allocated, and gets width from there, otherwise uses global defaut width

element.name: TColumn.GetDisplayName
element.short: GetDisplayName - if a field has been assigned, return the name of the field otherwise calls inherited GetDisplayName

element.name: TColumn.LinkField
element.short: LinkField - if the data link is Active, form the link with this feild

element.name: TColumn.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TColumn: calls inherited Create and sets a design index of appropriate size
element.descr: Create instantiates a new item in a . It is called by the function and should under normal circumstances never be called directly.

element.name: TColumn.Destroy
element.short: Destroys this collection item.

descr.p: Destroy removes the item from the managing collection and Destroys the item instance.
This is the only way to remove items from a collection;

element.name: TColumn.Field
element.short: The Field in the DataSet that is to be associated with this Column, for display , editinig etc
element.descr: Refers to the whole entity Field, including contents, name, position in the dataset, properties such as read/write enabling etc

element.name: TColumn.Assign
element.short: Assign - if the Source is a Grid, copies relevant values across, otherwise calls inherited Assign

element.name: TColumn.GetDefaultAlignment
element.short: GetDefaultAlignment - returns the supplied alignment if valid, otherwise returns the inherited default

element.name: TColumn.GetDefaultDisplayFormat
element.short: GetDefaultDisplayFormat - returns a string containing the default format for display

element.name: TColumn.GetDefaultValueChecked
element.short: GetDefaultValueChecked - if the value of the checked item is boolean, returns the boolean expressed as a string

element.name: TColumn.GetDefaultValueUnchecked
element.short: GetDefaultValueUnchecked - if the value of the unchecked item is boolean, returns the boolean expressed as a string

element.name: TColumn.IsAutomaticColumn
element.short: IsAutomaticColumn - if True, this is an automatic column

element.name: TColumn.IsDesignColumn
element.short: IsDesignColumn - if True, this is a design column

element.name: TColumn.DesignIndex
element.short: DesignIndex - the likely maximum index value

element.name: TColumn.DisplayFormat
element.short: The format to be used for display in this column

element.name: TColumn.FieldName
element.short: The name of the field (as a string), as returned from the dataset

element.name: TDbGridColumns
element.short: TDBGridColumns - the columns of data found in a Database Grid

element.name: TDbGridColumns.Update
element.short: Update - calls LayoutChanged if updates required

element.name: TDbGridColumns.ColumnFromField
element.short: ColumnFromField - returns the column identity corresponding to the given field

element.name: TDbGridColumns.Add
element.short: Add - first removes any autocolumns, then calls inherited Add

element.name: TDbGridColumns.LinkFields
element.short: LinkFields - links all the fields to the corresponding items in the list of columns

element.name: TDbGridColumns.Items
element.short: Items - the indexed array of Columns that hold the data in the Grid

element.name: TDBGridColumns.HasAutomaticColumns
element.short: HasAutomaticColumns - checks through the list of columns, and if any one IsAutomaticColumn, returns True

element.name: TDBGridColumns.HasDesignColumns
element.short: HasDesignColumns - checks through the list of columns, and if any one IsDesignColumn, returns True

element.name: TDBGridColumns.RemoveAutoColumns
element.short: RemoveAutoColumns - goes through the list of columns and removes any that are automatic

descr.p: RemoveAutoColumns - goes through the list of columns and removes any that are automatic
Only does this if HasAutomaticColumns is True

element.name: TDBGridColumns.ResetColumnsOrder
element.short: ResetColumnsOrder if coDesignOrder has been specified, rearrange the columns in the specified order

element.name: TCustomDbGrid
element.short: TCustomDBGrid - the base class for TDBGrid , for displaying database information in the manner of a StringGrid

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.UpdateData
element.short: UpdateData - implements any pending changes in the data: uses a method appropriate to the data type of the field

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.GetDsFieldFromGridColumn
element.short: GetDsFieldFromGridColumn - returns the identity of the DataSet field corresponding to the nominated grid column

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.GetFieldFromGridColumn
element.short: GetFieldFromGridColumn obtain the field either from a Db column or directly from dataset fields

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.GetGridColumnFromField
element.short: GetGridColumnFromField - obtain the corresponding grid column for the given field

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.FieldIndexFromGridColumn
element.short: FieldIndexFromGridColumn returns the index for the database field corresponding to the stated grid column

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.BeginLayout
element.short: BeginLayout starts producing the layout for the grid

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.CellClick
element.short: CellClick - calls the OnCellClickevent handler if it is assigned for this particular cell

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.CreateWnd
element.short: CreateWnd - creates the window: calls inherited CreateWnd and adjusts layout if needed, in particular putting in scrollbars

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.DefaultDrawCell
element.short: DefaultDrawCell - the default method for drawing a cell at the specified location, depending on the type of cell

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.DoExit
element.short: DoExit - closes down data links and calls inherited DoExit

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.DoOnChangeBounds
element.short: DoOnChangeBounds - calls inherited DoOnChangeBounds, adjusts layout if required

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.EditingColumn
element.short: EditingColumn - the Ok status is true if the data are being modified over the link

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.EditorCancelEditing
element.short: EditorCancelEditing - cancels changes and disables editing processes

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.EditordoGetValue
element.short: EditorDoGetValue - calls inherited EditorDoGetValue and performs UpdateData

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.EditorCanAcceptKey
element.short: EditorCanAcceptKey checks the integrity of the datalink and that the key and field are valid character entities

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.EndLayout
element.short: EndLayout - finishes modifying layout

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.GetEditMask
element.short: GetEditMask - checks datalink, finds field value and calls OnFieldEditMask if it is assigned

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.GetEditText
element.short: GetEditText - checks the datalink, finds field and loads its text

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.GridCanModify
element.short: GridCanModify returns True if datalink is active and allows editing, and readonly is not set

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.HeaderClick
element.short: HeaderClick - calls OnHeaderClick if assigned

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.KeyDown
element.short: KeyDown - checks key for a number of special cases, and calls the OnKeyDown event handler if assigned, otherwise calls inherited KeyDown

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.LinkActive
element.short: LinkActive - if False, calls RemoveAutomaticColumns and LayoutChanged

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.LayoutChanged
element.short: LayoutChanged - links columns to fields, inserts any required automatic columns

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.MoveSelection
element.short: MoveSelection - calls inherited MoveSelection and updates the Active state

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.MouseDown
element.short: MouseDown - checks for a number of special cases and calls the OnMouseDown event handler, or calls inherited MouseDown

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.UpdateActive
element.short: UpdateActive - updates the Active status for the field and record

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.UpdateGridCounts
element.short: UpdateGridCounts - modifies the total sizes allowing for any pending changes

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.DataSource
element.short: The DataSource from which this grid displays - usually the result of a database Query

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.ReadOnly
element.short: Set True to prevent writing to grid; set False to allow modification

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.OnCellClick
element.short: Event handler for mouse click in a cell of the grid

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.OnColEnter
element.short: Event handler if mouse enters column or it gains focus

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.OnColExit
element.short: Event handler if mouse leaves column or it loses focus

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.OnColumnMoved
element.short: OnColumnMoved - event handler for moving a column

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.OnDrawColumnCell
element.short: Event handler if the cell in this column requires to be drawn

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.OnFieldEditMask
element.short: Event handler if field is associated with an edit mask

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.OnTitleClick
element.short: Event handler for mouse click on Title

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomDBGrid: calls inherited Create then sets up datalink events, options and defaults

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.DefaultDrawColumnCell
element.short: DefaultDrawColumnCell - the default method for drawing cells in this column

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TCustomDbGrid: frees rows, frees the datalink, calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TCustomDbGrid.SelectedField
element.short: The selected field, for editing, data input or simply viewing

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.AddAutomaticColumns
element.short: AddAutomaticColumns add as many columns as there are fields in the dataset; do this only at runtime.

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.InvalidateSizes
element.short: InvalidateSizes renders the Sizes non-valid

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.ColumnEditorStyle
element.short: ColumnEditorStyle - returns a button style appropriate to the kind of column being edited

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.DoMouseWheelDown
element.short: DoMouseWheelDown - calls the OnMouseWheelDown event handler if assigned, and adjusts position of pointer over the link

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.DoMouseWheelUp
element.short: DoMouseWheelUp - calls the OnMouseWheelUp event handler if assigned, and adjusts position of pointer over the link

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.DoPrepareCanvas
element.short: DoPrepareCanvas - calls the OnPrepareCanvas event handler if assigned

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.DrawCheckboxBitmaps
element.short: DrawCheckboxBitmaps calls DrawGridCheckboxBitmaps after checking that datatype of relevant cell is boolean

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.DrawFixedText
element.short: DrawFixedText draws the text in a fixed row

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.GetBufferCount
element.short: GetBufferCount - returns the size of the buffer

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.GetDefaultColumnAlignment
element.short: GetDefaultColumnAlignment - gets a default alignment from the stated column if it has one, otherwise supplies a default LeftJustify alignment

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.GetDefaultColumnWidth
element.short: GetDefaultColumnWidth - calls DefaultFieldColWidth (private function)

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.GetDefaultColumnReadOnly
element.short: GetDefaultColumnReadOnly - finds default ReadOnly status for column from data link

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.GetDefaultColumnTitle
element.short: GetDefaultColumnTitle - returns the display name from the nominated grid column

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.GetDefaultRowHeight
element.short: GetDefaultRowHeight calls inherited GetDefaultRowHeight and makes it a little smaller

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.RemoveAutomaticColumns
element.short: RemoveAutomaticColumns - strips out any automatic columns from the grid

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.GridStatus
element.short: GridStatus - the status of the grid (whether updating, removing auto columns etc)

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.OptionsExtra
element.short: OptionsExtra - the extra options for this grid
element.descr: OptionsExtra - the extra options for this grid: autocolumns and enable checkboxes

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.SelectedRows
element.short: SelectedRows - recorded as a bookmark list

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.OnColumnSized
element.short: OnColumnSized - event handler for re-sizing a column

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.OnPrepareCanvas
element.short: OnPrepareCanvas - event handler for preparing canvas

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.OnSelectEditor
element.short: OnSelectEditor - event handler for selecting editor

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.OnUserCheckboxBitmap
element.short: OnUserCheckboxBitmap - event handler: user-defined bitmap for checkboxes

descr.p: OnUserCheckboxBitmap - event handler: user-defined bitmap for checkboxes
The user is encouraged to provide bitmaps to represent the three states for database grid checkboxes: gcbpUnChecked, gcbpChecked and gcbpGrayed

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.InitiateAction
element.short: Initiate the action associated with this control

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.ResetColWidths
element.short: ResetColWidths - restore the column widths to their default values

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.SelectedIndex
element.short: Selected index - number of the row selected for viewing or editing

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.SelectedColumn
element.short: The selected column for viewing or editing
element.descr: Columns and fields are often used interchangeably, but their properties are different.

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.ThumbTracking
element.short: ThumbTracking - returns True if thumb tracking is used

element.name: TdbGrid
element.short: TdbGrid - a data-aware version of TStringGrid, for displaying and operating on a series of Rows and Columns from a database

descr.p: TdbGrid - a data-aware version of TStringGrid, for displaying and operating on a series of Rows and Columns from a database
Inherits many of its properties from TCustomGrid and, of course, from TCustomDBGrid

element.name: TdbGrid.Canvas
element.descr:
The Canvas is the area of screen on which the various components are drawn.
This inherits its properties from TCanvas,
and that description should be read to understand their definitions more fully.

descr.p: // standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Either reads a flag containing alignment instructions (FAlign) or writes alignment instructions (SetAlign)
May have no alignment, may have custom or client alignment, or can be aligned to top, bottom, left or right
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Determines how the control is to be anchored to its client or parent conrol
Either reads a flag containing the set of anchors to be used, or writes a set of anchors. If they have been written, this is indicated in IsAnchorsStored

element.name: TdbGrid.BorderStyle
element.descr: Only a restricted series of options is available: none or a single border.

descr.p: // standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads the value for colour, or stores the value, and sets a flag if the colour is stored.
The default colour is the same as the window in which the control is located.
Refers to the physical columns of the grid, displaying the contents of the relevant Fields

The Columns property is configurable from the Object Inspector by selecting the ellipsis (...) next to the property name, in which case a pop-up memo box appears to allow editing. It deals with things like the size, shape and format of the display, and contains a link to the appropriate Field.

Do no confuse Grid columns (in the display) with the SQL usage of COLUMNS, which corresponds to Fields in our environment. The Fields consist of a series of cells arranged in Records, which contain the actual data which are to be displayed and operated upon.

It is entirely possible that not all fields of the dataset are displayed, and so fields do not correspond directly to columns; in fact the Columns property allows the user to configure which data field is to be displayed in each column
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Determine Constraints (max and min height and width) for this control; reads the size constraints or stores new ones.
If new rows of the grid are created by changing the RowCount property, the height of these new rows will be set to the value of the DefaultRowHeight property.
After that the user may redefine this value. If the Options property includes the appropriate value, the row height may also be changed by the user at runtime.
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Whether the control is Enabled. If not, it usually appears 'greyed-out'
Reads a flag to see whether the control is enabled, or stores a new value. If stored, sets a flag to say so.

element.name: TdbGrid.PopupMenu
TdbGrid.ShowHint
element.descr:
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Reads flag or writes one to determine if a hint is to be shown when mouse hovers over this control. If value is stored, a storage flag is set. Display of the actual hint is controlled by OnShowHint

element.name: TdbGrid.TabOrder
element.descr: Reads or writes information in flag; default is -1

descr.p: Reads or writes boolean flag; default is False
Use the TabStop to allow or disallow access to the control using the Tab key.
If TabStop is True, the control is in the tab order. If TabStop is False, the control is not in the tab order and the user can't use the Tab key to move to the control.

element.name: TdbGrid.Visible
element.short: Visible - can the control be seen?

descr.pre: The Visible property represents the ability to see a visual control. If Visible is True the control is shown, otherwise it is hidden. Calling Show sets, among others, Visible to True. Setting Visible to False is equivalent to calling Hide method.
descr.remark: The Visible property does not depend on control's parent visibility. Use IsVisible method to consider this and get real visibility.

descr.p: Double-clicking is much more common in a Windows environment than in Unix or Linux, where single-clicking is the default method for selecting an object. However, in all environments there could be valid use for a double-click, and a method should be supplied if appropriate.
OnKeyDown - event handler for instance when key is down while control has focus
Differs from OnKeyPress in that the key may have already been down when the control received focus; with OnKeyPress the key needs to become pressed while the control has focus.
OnKeyPress - event controller for a key being pressed while the control has focus
Differs from OnKeyDown in that the key needs to become pressed while the control has focus; with OnKeyDown the key may have already been down when the control received focus.
OnKeyUp - event handler for instance when a key is up (not pressed) while the control has focus
The key may already have been up when the control received focus, or a pressed key may become released during the time the control has focus.
// standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants
Determines the border spacing for this control
Reads flag to find stored spacing values required for the border of the control, or writes the flag to set the spacing.
The properties are defined in the parent class TControlBorderSpacing

element.name: TBMStringList
element.short: TBMStringList - a special StringList for BookMarks in a DataBase Grid

element.name: TCustomDBGrid.IsValidChar
element.short: IsValidChar - returns True if the supplied field contains a valid ASCII or UTF8 character
